channel.title: CVE Feed for VMware -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for VMware -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-34056|2023-10-25T04:24:47.707Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server
item.description: vCenter Server contains a partial information disclosure vulnerability. A malicious actor with non-administrative privileges to vCenter Server may leverage this issue to access unauthorized data.

item.title: CVE-2023-34046|2023-10-20T08:59:08.671Z -- vmware -- fusion
item.description: VMware Fusion(13.x prior to 13.5) contains a TOCTOU (Time-of-check Time-of-use) vulnerability that occurs during installation for the first time (the user needs to drag or copy the application to a folder from the '.dmg' volume) or when installing an upgrade. A malicious actor with local non-administrative user privileges may exploit this vulnerability to escalate privileges to root on the system where Fusion is installed or being installed for the first time.

item.title: CVE-2023-34045|2023-10-20T09:00:30.352Z -- vmware -- fusion
item.description: VMware Fusion(13.x prior to 13.5) contains a local privilege escalation vulnerability that occurs during installation for the first time (the user needs to drag or copy the application to a folder from the '.dmg' volume) or when installing an upgrade. A malicious actor with local non-administrative user privileges may exploit this vulnerability to escalate privileges to root on the system where Fusion is installed or being installed for the first time.

item.title: CVE-2023-34044|2023-10-20T08:56:53.136Z -- vmware -- workstation
item.description: VMware Workstation( 17.x prior to 17.5) and Fusion(13.x prior to 13.5) contain an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that exists in the functionality for sharing host Bluetooth devices with the virtual machine. A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may be able to read privileged information contained in hypervisor memory from a virtual machine.

item.title: CVE-2023-34048|2024-06-04T17:21:08.802Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server
item.description: vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds write potentially leading to remote code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20891|2023-07-26T05:41:23.643Z -- vmware -- vmware%20tanzu%20application%20service%20for%20vms
item.description: The VMware Tanzu Application Service for VMs and Isolation Segment contain an information disclosure vulnerability due to the logging of credentials in hex encoding in platform system audit logs. A malicious non-admin user who has access to the platform system audit logs can access hex encoded CF API admin credentials and can push new malicious versions of an application. In a default deployment non-admin users do not have access to the platform system audit logs.

item.title: CVE-2023-20896|2023-06-22T12:00:45.390Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server%20%28vcenter%20server%29
item.description: The VMware vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds read vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bounds read by sending a specially crafted packet leading to denial-of-service of certain services (vmcad, vmdird, and vmafdd).

item.title: CVE-2023-20895|2023-06-22T11:57:15.954Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server%20%28vcenter%20server%29
item.description: The VMware vCenter Server contains a memory corruption vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger a memory corruption vulnerability which may bypass authentication.

item.title: CVE-2023-20894|2023-06-22T11:54:04.383Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server%20%28vcenter%20server%29
item.description: The VMware vCenter Server contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may trigger an out-of-bound write by sending a specially crafted packet leading to memory corruption.

item.title: CVE-2023-20893|2023-06-22T11:52:32.771Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server%20%28vcenter%20server%29
item.description: The VMware vCenter Server contains a use-after-free vulnerability in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code on the underlying operating system that hosts vCenter Server.

item.title: CVE-2023-20867|2023-06-13T16:47:30.401Z -- vmware -- vmware%20tools
item.description: A fully compromised ESXi host can force VMware Tools to fail to authenticate host-to-guest operations, impacting the confidentiality and integrity of the guest virtual machine.

item.title: CVE-2023-20892|2023-06-22T11:47:25.876Z -- vmware -- vmware%20vcenter%20server%20%28vcenter%20server%29
item.description: The vCenter Server contains a heap overflow vulnerability due to the usage of uninitialized memory in the implementation of the DCERPC protocol. A malicious actor with network access to vCenter Server may exploit heap-overflow vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the underlying operating system that hosts vCenter Server.

item.title: CVE-2024-22264|2024-06-04T17:52:46.529Z -- vmware -- vmware%20avi%20load%20balancer
item.description: VMware Avi Load Balancer contains a privilege escalation vulnerability. A malicious actor with admin privileges on VMware Avi Load Balancer can create, modify, execute and delete files as a root user on the host system.

item.title: CVE-2024-22245|2024-02-20T17:35:09.051Z -- vmware -- vmware%20enhanced%20authentication%20plug-in%20%28eap%29
item.description: Arbitrary Authentication Relay and Session Hijack vulnerabilities in the deprecated VMware Enhanced Authentication Plug-in (EAP) could allow a malicious actor that could trick a target domain user with EAP installed in their web browser into requesting and relaying service tickets for arbitrary Active Directory Service Principal Names (SPNs).

item.title: CVE-2024-22250|2024-02-20T17:35:23.481Z -- vmware -- vmware%20enhanced%20authentication%20plug-in%20%28eap%29
item.description: Session Hijack vulnerability in Deprecated VMware Enhanced Authentication Plug-in could allow a malicious actor with unprivileged local access to a windows operating system can hijack a privileged EAP session when initiated by a privileged domain user on the same system.

item.title: CVE-2024-22266|2024-06-04T17:52:37.209Z -- vmware -- vmware%20avi%20load%20balancer
item.description: VMware Avi Load Balancer contains an information disclosure vulnerability. A malicious actor with access to the system logs can view cloud connection credentials in plaintext.
